experience.title: Data Manager
description: Oversee and maintain the data infrastructure for multiple Leidos FUSRAP laboratories, ensuring accurate capture, storage, and reporting of hazardous waste data.

Designed and deployed a custom Laboratory Information Management System (LIMS) that automates sample intake, inventory tracking, equipment management, data transformation, and regulatory reporting — saving $500,000+ per site implemented.
Ensure compliance with regulatory standards from EPA, DOD, ISO, and USACE by implementing robust data governance practices across laboratory operations.
Engineered data pipelines and infrastructure to support processing increasing quantities of sensitive data.

experience.title: Data Analyst
description: Spearheaded multiple initiatives, delivering actionable insights that improved municipal operations and decision-making.
Designed and implemented an automated utility collections calculator, reducing manual workload by 10+ hours weekly and improving billing efficiency.
Deployed a high-accuracy abnormal usage detection algorithm, achieving a 200%+ increase in anomaly identification.
Presented technical findings and strategic recommendations to government officials, bridging data and public policy.

experience.title: Imagery & GIS Analyst
description: Delivered high-impact imagery insights using the Rapid Automatic Image Categorization (RAIC) platform for clients including the U.S. Government, EPA, and Microsoft.
Developed custom scripts and automation tools to optimize feature engineering pipelines, accelerating RAIC’s model training and accuracy.
Created statistical reports and performance dashboards that assessed and validated real-world system effectiveness.
